title: Can I use electric bass strings on an acoustic bass? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Scale length is wrong. The tension on electric Bass strings is different than acoustic Bass strings and could potentially damage your instrument. Electric Bass strings are made to vibrate in front of magnetic pickups to generate sound. Acoustic Bass strings are meant to vibrate acoustically to reproduce sound from the Bass itself. There are other, but I think you get the idea that they won’t work.

NO! You CANNOT! Acoustic BASS (upright) are nylon/horsehide. They are for acoustic use ONLY. Electric BASS strings are typically FLATWOUND and/or a combination of ROUNDWOUND METAL (think pickup) and are a different animal completely……

No. Scale length is way off, string materiel between the two is not compatible. String tensions will turn your bass into a pretzel. And yes, this applies to the Armstrong/Ampeg/Baldwin upright electric as well. They all work from bridge transducers, not electromagnetic pickups.
If you mean an acoustic bass guitar, then yes you can but the tone will suffer. If you mean an upright bass then no, you need strings specifically intended for tge instrument.
If you are talking about an upright bass….No…if you are talking about an acoustic/electric bass guitar yes you can….I use flat wound strings on my acoustic bass guitars
